job_description: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, ROS Experience - job post Roblox 34 reviews San Mateo, CA 94401 $218,540 - $283,780 a year -  Internship Roblox 34 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $218,540 - $283,780 a year Job Type Internship Every day, tens of millions of people come to Roblox to explore, create, play, learn, and connect with friends in 3D immersive digital experiences– all created by our global community of developers and creators. At Roblox, we're building the tools and platform that empower our community to bring any experience that they can imagine to life. Our vision is to reimagine the way people come together, from anywhere in the world, and on any device. We're on a mission to connect a billion people with optimism and civility, and looking for amazing talent to help us get there. A career at Roblox means you'll be working to shape the future of human interaction, solving unique technical challenges at scale, and helping to create safer, more civil shared experiences for everyone. ROS Experiences is a new team working across two exciting projects with more expected as we continue to grow. Multiple projects will add variety to our team members' day-to-day work, regularly offering them new and interesting challenges. Our work on Assessment Tools has proven immensely successful in vetting the best NCG and Intern candidates and will only grow going forward. Our newest project, Roblox Office, is only just ramping up and those that join will be on the ground floor of helping define the future of work and collaboration within the Roblox ecosystem. We are one of very few groups within the company that use Roblox's external facing tools to develop and deploy to the Roblox platform. As such, we are able to help shape the future technologies that Roblox will provide to its Creators. You Are Passionate about and an expert at building web applications and knowledgeable with front and back-end technologies A technical contributor that can translate product requirements into scalable architecture Proficient in writing readable, extensible, modular, and testable code Effective at collaborating with individuals from all disciplines Able to work in a fast paced environment with competing priorities Comfortable working across multiple teams to make pragmatic tradeoffs and quick decisions You Will Translate product designs into accessible user experiences Build and maintain internal component libraries Build and maintain backend systems inside and outside of the Roblox ecosystem Collaborate with many disciplines to build experiences in Roblox Studio to run on the Roblox platform Architect and build systems and user facing features Work closely with live-ops and the rest of the technical team to maintain multiple, always-on, products Mentor other engineers as well as non-technical team members You Have BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience 3+ years of experience working as a software engineer Experience with one or more modern front-end web frameworks Expertise with 2+ programming languages Bonus: Experience with Roblox Studio or other game engine editors Bonus: Experience developing game systems and architecture For roles that are based at our headquarters in San Mateo, CA: The starting base pay for this position is as shown below. The actual base pay is dependent upon a variety of job-related factors such as professional background, training, work experience, location, business needs and market demand. Therefore, in some circumstances, the actual salary could fall outside of this expected range. This pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. All full-time employees are also eligible for equity compensation and for benefits. Annual Salary Range $218,540—$283,780 USD You'll Love: Industry-leading compensation package Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage A rewarding 401k program Flexible vacation policy Roflex - Flexible and supportive work policy Roblox Admin badge for your avatar At Roblox HQ: Free catered lunches five times a week and several fully stocked kitchens with unlimited snacks Onsite fitness center and fitness program credit Annual CalTrain Go Pass Roblox provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Site Reliability Engineer - job post Trade Terminal San Francisco Bay Area, CA $75,000 - $125,000 a year -  Full-time, Internship Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $75,000 - $125,000 a year Job Type Full-time Internship SRE (Site Reliability Engineer) As an SRE, your job responsibilities include: 1. Responsible for the design and development of the overall automated operation and maintenance platform of the system; 2. Responsible for the promotion, application and operational support of the DevOps platform, and assist the R&D team to use DevOps products to improve performance and use them efficiently DevOps toolchain; 3. Familiar with docker/k8s container, and perform exception handling and analysis Understand jenkins/git and other related technologies 4. Responsible for following up the collection, construction and optimization of project operation and maintenance requirements; 5. Familiar with the architecture and working principles of virtualization platforms such as KVM/docker, and understand the principles of OpenStack/vmware 6. Familiar with the principles and deployment of middleware applications such as zookeeper/ ELK/RabbitMQ and the deployment of ansible batch configuration and management tools And optimization management, can use Zabbix to monitor the system, network and service. As an SRE, you will need to meet the following job requirements: 1. Bachelor degree or above in computer-related majors, at least 3 years of practical experience in application operation and maintenance or R&D experience in operation and maintenance automation platforms, familiar with software development and system architecture; 2. Proficient in development languages ​​and technologies such as python/shell, familiar with distributed framework and microservice architecture, and proficient in application operation and maintenance links; 3. Familiar with system tools and processes related to operation and maintenance, familiar with DEVOPS/CI/CD, etc., and have corresponding secondary development capabilities, such as: changing the system, Promethus system monitoring system, etc.; 4. Physical host io performance, network bandwidth, memory exception and hard disk fault handling, summary of fault handling report feedback Job Types: Full-time, Internship Pay: $75,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year Physical setting: Office Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): What is your experience with AWS, especially with EC2, S3, VOC and IAM? Do you have any experience with Kubernetes, specifically with 100+ launches over the past 2 years? Do you have any relevant experience with virtual machines? If so, please briefly describe. Would you please give us a concise and short summary of your OpenStack experience? Experience: LAN/DNS/VPN/DHCP (Required) Work Location: In person If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
